channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Is Happening With Fyre Festival 2?
item.description: The organizers of Fyre Festival 2, a sequel to the ill-fated music event in 2017, said the festival would not longer take place in Playa del Carmen.

item.title: U.S. Bank’s new CEO Gunjan Kedia says she’s ‘not happy’ with its stock price: Urgency, discipline, and growth will be key to her tenure
item.description: New U.S. Bank CEO Gunjan Kedia outlined a focused strategy of urgency, expense discipline, and organic growth to regain investor confidence amid turbu...

item.title: Getting good jobs out of Trump’s tariff policy demands a labor movement his administration is bent on kneecapping, union historian says
item.description: Even if tariffs bring back millions of jobs, businesses will still try to pay as little as possible, unless forced to act otherwise.

item.title: Harvard’s famous endowment will help it withstand Trump—to a point. ‘It’s not a $50 billion bank account’
item.description: Can Harvard afford to tap its endowment to make up for lost federal funding? It's complicated.

item.title: Michigan community forms human chain to help local bookstore move its stock of 9,100 books to a new location
Google Is a Monopolist in Online Advertising Tech, Judge Says
item.description: The ruling was the second time in a year that a federal court had found that Google had acted illegally to maintain its dominance.

item.title: He Wanted Peace in the Middle East. ICE Wants to Deport Him.
item.description: Mohsen Mahdawi was arrested at a citizenship interview in Vermont. He had spent a decade trying to understand the conflict that shaped his life, his s...

item.title: Why Does Harvard Have Tax-Exempt Status and Can the IRS Revoke It? What to Know.
item.description: The university, like many colleges and charities, is exempt from federal income and property taxes, saving it billions of dollars. President Trump has...

item.title: Sainsbury’s reports healthy growth despite fears of a supermarket price war
item.description: The U.K. grocer invests in space and tech to drive growth, loyalty and availability as it braces itself for a price war.

item.title: 4 Men Charged With Trying to Smuggle Thousands of Ants From Kenya
item.description: The men, including two Belgian teenagers, pleaded guilty to smuggling thousands of live queen ants, which the Kenyan authorities said were destined fo...

item.title: Astronomers Detect a Signature of Life on a Distant Planet
item.description: Further studies are needed to determine whether K2-18b, which orbits a star 120 light-years away, is inhabited, or even habitable.

item.title: Hundreds of Capybaras ‘Conquered’ This Town. Now What?
item.description: The world’s largest rodent is multiplying in — and dividing — one of Argentina’s most exclusive gated communities.

item.title: Israel Strikes Area With Tent Camps for Displaced Gazans

item.title: Israeli Strike Kills at Least a Dozen in ‘Humanitarian Zone,’ Gazan Officials Say
item.description: Gaza’s Civil Defense, the local emergency rescue service, reported that an Israeli strike overnight into Thursday in the Mawasi encampment area killed...
